sentences: Hirini Whaanga Christy (16 August 1883 â€“ 1 July 1955) was a New Zealand  Mormon leader, farmer, interpreter, community leader.
He was born in Nuhaka, Hawke's Bay, New Zealand on 16 August 1883.
Christy emigrated to Utah Territory in 1894 with his extended family.
Christy attended high school in Salt Lake City and later graduated from Latter-day Saints' University, where he was a star athlete.
Christy was a member of the Mormon Tabernacle Choir and married Kathleen Welsh in 1907.
In 1918, Christy and his family returned to New Zealand and settled in Nuhaka.
